chapters.chapter_summary: The first chapter of Bhagavad Gita, Arjuna Vishrad Yoga, introduces the characters and circumstances that led to the Mahabharata Mahabharata between the Pandavas and the Kauravas. This chapter describes the reasons that led to the deity of the Bhagavad Gita. When Mahabali warrior Arjuna sees the warriors standing ready for war on both sides, he becomes unhappy and depressed due to the fear of losing his own relatives and friends and as a result. Therefore, he surrenders to Shri Krishna completely. Thus, there is light of knowledge of Bhagavad Gita.

chapters.chapter_summary:
The second chapter of Bhagavad Gita is Sankhya Yoga. This chapter is the most important chapter of the Bhagavad Gita because Lord Krishna condenses the teachings of the entire Gita. This chapter is the essence of the entire Gita. 
 Sankhya Yoga can be classified in 4 main subjects -
1. Arjuna completely surrendered to Lord Krishna and accepted him as his guru. 
2. The interpretation of the main causes of all sorrows, which is the ignorance of the true nature of the self. 
3. Karmayog - Discipline of selfless action without associating with the fruits of your actions. Description of a perfect man - whose brain is stable and one -eshara.

chapters.chapter_summary: The third chapter of Bhagavad Gita is the path of Karmayoga or selfless service. In this chapter, Lord Krishna emphasizes the importance of karma in life. They say that in this physical world, it is mandatory for every human being to join some kind of action. In addition, he tells about the tasks that bind humans or those who liberate humans. Those humans who continue to do their duties continuously for the happiness of God and without expecting fruit, they attain liberation in the end.

chapters.chapter_summary: The fourth chapter of the Bhagavad Gita is the Yoga Yoga Gyan Darma Sanyasayas Yoga. In this chapter, Shri Krishna praises Karmayoga or makes Arjuna aware of the soul and the ultimate truth. They describe the reason behind their presence in the physical world. They say that even though he is eternal, he is still born from time to time to re -establish religion and peace on this earth. His birth and activities are eternal and are never contaminated by collective defects. Those humans who know and understand this truth do devotion to them with full devotion and eventually receive them. They do not need to be born again in this world.

chapters.chapter_summary: The eighth chapter of Bhagavad Gita is Aksharbrahmayoga. In this chapter, Krishna explains the importance of the final idea before death. If we remember Krishna at the time of death, we will definitely receive him. Therefore, it is very important to have awareness about God at all times, think about them and chant their names all the time. We can go to the highest residence of God beyond this physical world by incorporating our mind completely in the constant devotion of Krishna.

chapters.chapter_summary: The ninth chapter of Bhagavad Gita is Rajvidyarajaguhyayoga. In this chapter, Krishna explains that he is supreme and this physical world is composed and fragmented by his Yogamaya or humans keep coming under his supervision. They describe the role and importance of devotion to our spiritual awareness. In such devotion, man should survive only for God, dedicate himself to God and everything should be done for God. One who follows this type of devotion is freed from the shackles of this physical world and units with God.

verse.word_meanings: (Seven) seven (Maharshis) Maharshis (Chatvarah) four (purve) Sanka and others (and) and (Manavas) Svayambhuva etc. Chaidah Manu ye (madbhavah) all (manasah) from my resolve (manasah) all (manasah) in Me.are (yesham) whose (loke) world (imaḥ) this (prajaḥ) all the subjects।

verse.meaning: The man who knows this permanent Vibhuti of mine and Yogashakti with element (whatever is a visible world is the illusion of God and a Vasudev is perfect everywhere, to know this with the element)Goes- there is no doubt in it.
verse.text:
एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्वत: |
सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशय: ॥7॥
verse.word_meanings: (यः) who (मम) my (एतम्) thus (विभूतिम्) glories (च) and (योगम्) the power of Yoga (तत्त्वतः) in the essence (वेत्ति) knows (सः) that (अविक्षेन) steady (योगेन) by devotional yoga (युज्यते)It becomes fit (Atra) in it (sanshayah) there is no doubt (n)।

verse.meaning: I am the reason for the origin of the entire world and all the world tries to me, in this way, intelligent devotees with reverence and devotion continuously worship me God.
verse.text:
अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्त: सर्वं प्रवर्तते |
इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विता: ॥8॥
verse.word_meanings: (अहम्) I am (सर्वस्य) all (प्रहवः) the cause of origin (मतः) according to My knowledge (सर्वम्) all the world (प्रवर्वतते) strives (इति) thus (मत्वा) understanding (भावसंसमनितः) with faith and devotion (बुधाः)) The wise devotees who have not found the Tattvadarshi saint are (Mam) Me (Bhajante) constantly worship Me।

verse.meaning: Continuing the mind in me and those who offer my life in me (those who have offered their lives for Vasudeva, their name is Madtprana.) Devotees knowing my impact and quality by discussing my devotion by discussing my devotion.Including me, they are constantly satisfied while making my statement and I continue to be Raman in Vasudeva.
verse.text:
मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्त: परस्परम् |
कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ॥9॥
verse.word_meanings: (म0तप्राणाः) beings based on Me (बोधयन्तः) those who know this (च) and (मच्चित्ताः) absorbed in Me (परस्परम्) in you (कथायन्तः) thinking (च) and (नित्यम्) eternal (तुष्यन्ति) satisfied.(f) and (my) in Me (ramanti) absorbed in Me।

verse.meaning: I give that philosophy yoga to the devotees who are engaged in those constant meditation etc. and lovingly worshiping, from which they get me.
verse.text:
तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् |
ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ॥10॥
verse.word_meanings: (तेषाम्) those (सत्तयुक्तानाम्) constantly engaged in the thought of knowledge and (प्रीतपुव्यकम्) lovingly (भजताम्) those who worship (तम्) the same session (बुद्धियोगम्) knowledge yoga (दादामि) by which (ते) they (ते) they (ते) they (ते)Mam) I (Upayanti) attain Me।

verse.meaning: Hey Arjun!To grace them, I was situated in their conscience, I myself destroy their ignorant darkness through the light lamp.
verse.text:
तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तम: |
नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता ॥11॥
verse.word_meanings: (अहम्) I (एव) only (तेषाम्) on them (अनुकाम्पार्थम्) to have mercy (अज्ञानजम्) arising from ignorance (तमः) darkness (नाशयामि) destroy.(Atmabhavasthaḥ) entering like a ghost, as the soul is established in the body as the soul speaks.By the same feeling, that is, by the self-consciousness, I offer you (Jnanadeepena) the lamp of knowledge (Bhasvata) in the form of knowledge.।

verse.meaning: Arjuna said- You are the ultimate Brahma, Param Dham and the ultimate sacred, because you are called all sages Sanatan, Divine Purush and Gods also called Adidev, unborn and omnipresent.
verse.text:
अर्जुन उवाच |
परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् |
पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम् ॥12॥
verse.word_meanings: (भावन्) You (परम्) the supreme (ब्रह्म) Brahman (परम्) the supreme (धाम) abode and (परमम्) the supreme (पवित्राम्) holy because (त्वाम्) You (सर्वे) all (रिषयः) sages (शाश्वतम्) eternal (दिव्यम्)Divine (purusham) Purusha and (Adidevam) also the original God (Ajam) unborn and (Vibhum) omnipresent (Ahu)हैं

verse.meaning: In the same way, Devarshi Narada and Asit and Deval Rishi and Maharishi Vyas are also called and you also say towards me.
verse.text:
आहुस्त्वामृषय: सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा |
असितो देवलो व्यास: स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे ॥13॥
verse.word_meanings: (तथा) Similarly (देवर्षिः) the devarshi (नारादः) Narada and (असितः) asita and (देवालः) Devala sage and (व्यासः) Maharshi Vyasa also say (च) and (स्वयम्) You (एव)hi (मे) me (मे) mefor (Bravishi) is called।

verse.meaning: Hey Keshav!Whatever you say towards me, I consider all this to be true.Hey God!Your leelamay (should see its expansion in the Gita chapter 4 verse 6) neither the demons nor the deity.
verse.text:
सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव |
न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवा: ॥14॥
verse.word_meanings: (Keshava) O Keshav!(यत्) whatever (माम्) me (वदसि) You say (एतत्) this (सर्वम्) all I (ऋतम्) truth (मन्ये) believe.(Lord) O Lord!(ते) Your (व्यक्तिम्) human beings like the embodied form (न) not (दानवाः) the demons (विदुः) know and (न) not (देवाः) gods (हि) hi।

verse.meaning: O those who produce ghosts!O God of ghosts!O Gods of Gods!Hey the lord of the world!Hey Purushottam!You know yourself by yourself.
verse.text:
स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम |
भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते ॥15॥
verse.word_meanings: (Bhootbhavana) O producer of beings!(Bhootesh) O Lord of beings!(Devadeva) O God of the gods!(Jagatpate) O Lord of the world!(Purushottama) O Purushotam!(त्वम्) You (स्वयम्) themselves (एव) only (आत्मना) from themselves (आत्मानम्) themselves (वेत्था) know themselves।

verse.meaning: Therefore, you are able to say their divine personalities completely, by which you are located by spreading all these worlds.
verse.text:
वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतय: |
याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि ॥16॥
verse.word_meanings: (hi) because (त्वम्) You are those (दिव्याः आत्मविभूतयः) their divine glories (अशेन) in full (वक्तुम्) in saying (अर्हसि) capable (यभिः) by whom you (इमन्) all these (लोकान्) worlds (लोकान्) the worlds ( लोकान्)व्याप्य) pervades (sthasi) situated।

verse.meaning: Hey Yogeshwar!How can I know you while thinking continuously and O Lord!In which expressions are you contemplating me?
verse.text:
कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् |
केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया ॥17॥
verse.word_meanings: (Yogin) O Lord of Yoga!(अहम्) I (कथाम्) how (सदा) constantly (परिचिन्तयन्) contemplating (त्वाम्) you (विद्याम्) know (च) and (Bhagavan) O Lord!You (केषु, keshu) in what (भावेषु) emotions (मया) by me (चिन्त्यः) thinking (असि).।

verse.meaning: Hey Janardan!Say your yogic power and Vibhuti in detail, because I do not have satisfaction while listening to your nectar words, that is, there is a furore to listen.
verse.text:
विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन |
भूय: कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् ॥18॥
verse.word_meanings: (Janardana) O Janardana!(आत्मनः) his (योगम्) Yoga-power (च) and (विभुतिम्) glories (भूयः) again (विश्वरेण) in detail (कथाय) say (हि) because of your (अमृतम्) immortal words (श्रृण्वतः) hearing (मे) me (सः सतिः) There is no thirst (n) i.e।

verse.meaning: Shri Bhagwan said- O Kurushreshtha!Now I will tell those who are my divine personalities with you with priority;Because my expansion does not end.
verse.text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतय: |
प्राधान्यत: कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे ||19||
verse.word_meanings: (Kurushrestha) O best of the Kurus!(hant) Now I (divyahatmavibhutiyah) My divine glories (te) for your (pradhanya) primacy (kathayishyami) I say (hi) because (me) my (vistarasya) expander (antah) end (n) is not (asti).।

verse.meaning: Hey Arjun!I am the soul of all the ghosts in the heart of all ghosts and I am the beginning, middle and end of the whole ghosts.
verse.text:
अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थित: |
अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ॥20॥
verse.word_meanings: (Gudakesha) O Arjuna!(Aham) I (sarvabhutashayasthitaḥ) in all beings (self) I am the soul, that is, the soul is not at all, therefore it is said (च) and (भूतानाम्) all living beings (आदिः) the beginning, (मध्यम्) middle (च) and (Anta) end (f) also (Aham) I (Eva) am I।

verse.meaning: I am Vishnu among the twelve sons of Aditi and the sun with rays among the Jyotis and I am the fast of the nine -bodies and the lord of the constellations.
verse.text:
आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान् |
मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी ॥21॥
verse.word_meanings: (अहम्) I (आदित्यानाम्) twelve sons (विष्णुः) Vishnu and (ज्योतिषाम्) lights (अंशुमान्) rays (रविः) the sun (अस्मि) I am and (अहम्) I (मरुताम्) the wind-gods (मरिचिः) the splendor and (नक्षत्राणाम्) stars(Shashi) Adhipati Chandrama।

verse.meaning: I am a Samveda in the Vedas, I am Indra among the gods, I am a mind in the senses and the consciousness of ghosts, that is, life-power.
verse.text:
वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासव: |
इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना ॥22॥
verse.word_meanings: (वेदानाम्) in the Vedas (सामवेदः) the Sama Veda (अस्मि) I am (देवानाम्) the gods (वसवः) Indra (अस्मि) I am, (इन्द्रियाणाम्) the senses (मनः) the mind (अस्मि) I am (च) and (भूतानाम्) the beings (चchetana) consciousnessThat is, I am the life force.।

verse.meaning: I am Shankar among the eleventh Rudras and Kubera, the lord of wealth in Yaksha and demons.I am a fire among eight Vasu and in the Shikharwale mountains, Sumeru mountain.
verse.text:
रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् |
वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरु: शिखरिणामहम् ॥23॥
verse.word_meanings: (Rudranam) in the eleven Rudras (Shankarah) I am (asmi) and (yaksharakshasam) among the yakshas and demons (vitteshah) the lord of wealth, Kubera (Aham) I (vasunam) in the eight Vasus (pavakah) fire (asmi) (f)and (shikharinam) in the mountains of the peak (meruḥ) Sumeru mountain।

verse.meaning: Jupiter, head among the priests, know me.Hey Partha!I am a sea in the generals and the sea in the reservoirs.
verse.text:
पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् |
सेनानीनामहं स्कन्द: सरसामस्मि सागर: ॥24॥
verse.word_meanings: (पुरोधासाम्) among the priests (मुख्यम्) the chief (बृहस्पतिम्) Brihaspati (माम्) me (विद्धि) know.(Partha) O Partha!(Aham) I (senaninam) in the commanders of the army (skanda) Skanda (cha) and (sarasam) in the reservoirs (sagarah) the sea (asmi)।

verse.meaning: I am Bhrigu in Maharishi and a letter in words ie Omkar.Among all types of yagyas, I am a mountain of joy and stable.
verse.text:
महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् |
यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालय: ॥25॥
verse.word_meanings: (अहम्) I (महृषिनाम्) among the great sages (भृगुः) Bhrigu and (गिराम्) words (एकम्) one (अक्षरम्) letter, that is, Omkara (अस्मि).(यज्ञानाम्) in all kinds of sacrifices (जपयायज्ञः) chanting sacrifices and (स्थावराणाम्) steady (हिमलयः) the Himalayas (अस्मि) I am)।

verse.meaning: I am the Peepal tree in all the trees, Narada Muni among the Devarshi, Chitraratha in Gandharvas and Kapil Muni in Siddhas.
verse.text:
अश्वत्थ: सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारद: |
गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथ: सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनि: ॥26॥
verse.word_meanings: (सर्ववृृक्षाणाम्) among all the trees (अश्वत्थः) the thick-headed tree (देवर्षिणाम्) among the sages of the gods (नारादः) the sage of Narada, (गन्धर्वाणाम्) the Gandharvas (चित्रारथः) Chitraratha (च) and (सिद्धानाम्) Siddhas (कापिलः) Kapila (मुनिः) sage।

verse.meaning: A horse called high -shrava, elephant named Airavat in the best elephants and the king in humans, to be born with nectar in horses.
verse.text:
उच्चै:श्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम् |
ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम् ॥27॥
verse.word_meanings: (अश्वानाम्) in the horses (अमृतोद्वाम्) arising with the nectar (उच्चैःश्रवासम्) the horse called Uchchaishrava, (गजेन्द्राणाम्) the best elephants (अीरावतम्) elephant named Airavata (च) and (नराणाम्) men (नराधिम्) king (माम्) me (विद्धि)।

verse.meaning: I am Vajra in weapons and Kamadhenu in cows.I am Cupid for the origin of the children in the scripture and I am Sarparaj Vasuki in the snakes.
verse.text:
आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् |
प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्प: सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकि: ॥28॥
verse.word_meanings: (अहम्) I (अयुधानाम्) in weapons (वज्रम्) thunderbolt and (धेनुनाम्) cows (कामधुक्) the cow of desire (अस्मि) I am.(प्रजनः) for the origin of children from the manner stated in the scriptures (कन्दरः) I am Cupid (च) and (सर्पानाम्) in snakes (सुकिः) the king of snakes (अस्मि) I am.।

verse.meaning: Among the serpents (Nag and Snake are the caste of two types of snakes.) I am the Lord of Sheshnag and Jalachars, Varuna deity and in the ancestors, I am an ancestor named Aryama and Yamraj among those who rule.
verse.text:
अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम् |
पितृणामर्यमा चास्मि यम: संयमतामहम् ॥29॥
verse.word_meanings: (अहम्) I (नागानाम्) in the serpents (अन्तः) the rest (च) and (यादसाम्) the lord of the water-walkers (वरुणः) the god of Varuna (अस्मि) I am (च) and (पितलाम्) in the ancestors (अर्यमा) the fathers and (संयामताम्)Among the rulers (यमः) Yamaraja (अहम्) I am (अस्मि)।

verse.meaning: I am the time of Prahlad and calculations in demons (I am the time in the moment, clock, day, side, month etc.) and Mrigraj Singh in animals and Garuda among birds.
verse.text:
प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां काल: कलयतामहम् |
मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम् ॥30॥
verse.word_meanings: (अहम्) I (दायित्यानाम्) among the demons (प्रहलादः) prahlad (च) and (कल्याताम्) counting (कालः) time (च) and (मृगाणाम्) animals (मृगेद्रः) deer lion (च) in birds(Aham) I (Vainateyah) Garuda।

verse.meaning: Among those who purify, I am Shri Ram among the air and weapons, but in the fish, but I am in the rivers and Shri Bhagirathi Gangaji.
verse.text:
पवन: पवतामस्मि राम: शस्त्रभृतामहम् |
झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी ॥31॥
verse.word_meanings: (अहम्) I (पवताम्) in the (पवनः) air and (श्रस्त्राभृृतम्) weapons in the weapons (रामः) Sri Rama (अस्मि) I am and (ज्षानाम्) fish (मकारः) my (अस्मि) and (स्त्रोतसाम्) rivers (जाह्नवी)Ganga (Asmi) I am।

verse.meaning: Hey Arjun!I am the beginning and end and middle of the universe.I am a suit for spiritualism in the disciplines, that is, the Brahmavidya and the dispute of mutual disputes.
verse.text:
सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन |
अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वाद: प्रवदतामहम् ॥32॥
verse.word_meanings: (Arjuna) O Arjuna!(सर्गाणाम्) the creations (आदिः) the beginning (च) and (अन्तः) the end (च) and (मध्यम्) the middle (अहम्) I (एव) am.(अहम्) I (विद्यानाम्) in the sciences (अध्याम्विद्या) the spiritual knowledge, that is, the Brahma-vidyā and (प्रवदताम्) the arguing of each other (वदः) the argument for the element-determination.।

verse.meaning: I am a soul in the letters and I am a component called duality in the compounds.I am also the Mahakal of Akshayakal i.e. the Mahakal and the face of the era, the vast form, the one who bears everyone.
verse.text:
अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्व: सामासिकस्य च |

chapters.chapter_summary: The twelfth chapter of Bhagavad Gita is Bhakti Yoga. In this chapter, Krishna emphasizes the superiority of Bhakti Yoga and describes various aspects of devotion. They further explain that those devotees who dedicate all their deeds to them, merge their consciousness in them and do devotion to them with true heart, they get rid of the cycle of life and death very quickly. They also describe various vibrations of their most dear devotees.

chapters.chapter_summary: The chapter of the Bhagavad Gita is the field-field. The word area means land and fielding means knowledge of the area. Our physical body is like a region and our immortal soul is the same. In this chapter, Krishna distinguishes between the physical body and the immortal soul. He explains that the physical body is temporary and destructive while the soul is permanent and eternal. The physical body can be destroyed but the soul can never be destroyed. This chapter then describes God, which is the supreme soul. All individual souls have originated from the supreme soul. The one who clearly understands the difference between the body, the soul and the supreme soul attains the divine.

chapters.chapter_summary: The fourteenth chapter of the Bhagavad Gita is the virtue. In this chapter, Krishna describes the three qualities of physical nature that affects everything in the physical world - goodness, longing and ignorance. Further, he describes the main characteristics or reasons of these three qualities and explains how these three qualities affect humans. He then describes the various characteristics of people who have won on these qualities. At the end of this chapter, Krishna reminds us of the power of true devotion and tells us how we can cross these qualities by joining God.

इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागता: |
सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च ॥2॥
verse.word_meanings: (इदम्) this (ज्ञानम्) knowledge (उपाश्रित्य) by taking refuge, that is, by holding (मम) my (सधम्र्यम्) qualities (आगताः) the seekers (सर्गे) do not arise in the beginning of creation (न उपजायन्ते) do not arise (च) and (प्रलये).) In the time of doom (also) also (na vyathanti) are not disturbed।

verse.meaning: Hey Arjun!My importance is the vagina of the entire ghosts, that is, the place of conception is the place of conception and I establish the conscious community in that vagina.The coincidence of that root-consciousness leads to the origin of all ghosts.
verse.text:
मम योनिर्महद् ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम् |
सम्भव: सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत ॥3॥
verse.word_meanings: (India) O Arjuna!(मम) My (महत्) basic nature, that is, Durga is the (योनिः) vaginal, that is, the place of conception and (अहम् Brahma) I am Brahma-kala (तस्मिन्) in that womb (गर्भम्) the womb (दधामि) (ततः)By that union (सर्वभूतानाम्) all living beings (सम्भवः) origin (भवति)।

verse.meaning: Hey Arjun!In all types of various types of vagrants, as many idols, ie body -borne creatures are produced, nature is the mother who conceives them all and I am a father to establish the seed.
verse.text:
सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तय: सम्भवन्ति या: |
तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रद: पिता ॥4॥
verse.word_meanings: (Kaunteya) O Arjuna!(सर्वयोनिषु) in all the vagina (याः) all (मूर्तयः) idols, i.e., the body-bearer (सम्भवन्ति) arise, (महत्) the root nature (तासाम्) all those (योनिः) mother is the mother and (अहम् Brahma) I (सेजदः) I am the father who establishes the seed (father)।

verse.meaning: O Arjuna!The three modes arising from nature bind the indestructible soul in the body.
verse.text:
सत्वं रजस्तम इति गुणा: प्रकृतिसम्भवा: |
निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम् ॥5॥
verse.word_meanings: (Mahabaho) O Arjuna!(satvam) the mode of Sattva, (rajah) the mode of passion and (tamah) the mode of darkness (iti) these (prakritisambhavah) arising from nature (gunah) the three qualities (avyayam) indestructible (dehinam) the soul (dehe) in the body (nibandhanti) binds (nibadhnanti)।

verse.meaning: Hey sin!In those three qualities, the sattvaguna is light due to being pure and without disorder, he binds from the relationship of happiness and with the relationship of knowledge, that is, with his pride.
verse.text:
तत्र सत्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम् |
सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ ॥6॥
verse.word_meanings: (Anagh) O sinless one!(तत्र) in those three qualities (सत्वम्) the mode of goodness (निर्मलत्वात्) being pure (प्रकाशकम्) the illuminator and (अनामयायम्) the fickle is the anami, he is (सुखसङ्न) with the relationship of happiness (च) and (ज्ञानसंगेन) with the relationship of knowledge, that is, his self-consciousness (बध्नाति)It is bound।

verse.meaning: Hey Arjun!Ragarup Rajoguna desire and life generated from attachment.He binds this soul in relation to deeds and their fruits.
verse.text:
रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम् |
तन्निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम् ॥7॥
verse.word_meanings: (Kaunteya) O Arjuna!(Ragaatmakam) the form of passion (rajah) the mode of passion (trishnasangasamudbhavam) arising from desire and attachment (viddhi) know (dehinam) this soul (karmasangena) by the relation of actions and their fruits (nibadhnati) binds (nibadhnati)।

verse.meaning: Hey Arjun!Tamoguna, who fascinates all the dehiabhiman, the life generated from ignorance.He binds this person with pramad (the name of the meaningless efforts of the senses and the conscience), laziness (the name of the unruly in the duty karma is 'laziness') and the sleep.
verse.text:
तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम् |
प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्नाति भारत ॥8॥
verse.word_meanings: (India) O Arjuna!(सर्वदेहिनाम्) the (मोहाम्) deluded (तमः) the mode of darkness (तु) then (अज्ञानजम्) arising from ignorance.(तत्) He (निबध्नाति) binds this soul (प्रमादालस्यसिनस्मित्रभिः) by negligence, laziness and sleep.।

verse.meaning: Hey Arjun!Sattvaguna applies in happiness and in Rajoguna karma and tamoguna also covers knowledge and also in pramad.
verse.text:
सत्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रज: कर्मणि भारत |
ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तम: प्रमादे सञ्जयत्युत ॥9॥
verse.word_meanings: (India) O Arjuna!(सत्वम्) the mode of goodness (सुक्षे) in happiness (सन्जयति) applies and (रजः) the mode of passion (कर्मणि) in action and (तमः) the mode of darkness (तु) then (ज्ञानम्) knowledge (अवृृत्य) cover (प्रमादे) in negligence (उत) also (सन्जयति)Lagata hai।

verse.meaning: Hey Arjun!By pressing Rajoguna and Tamoguna, by pressing Sattvaguna, Sattvaguna and Tamoguna, Rajoguna is the same by pressing Sattvaguna and Rajoguna, that is, it increases.
verse.text:
रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्वं भवति भारत |
रज: सत्वं तमश्चैव तम: सत्वं रजस्तथा ॥10॥
verse.word_meanings: (India) O Arjuna!(Rajaḥ) the mode of passion (cha) and (tamaḥ) the darkness of the darkness (abhibhuyā) by pressing (satvam) the mode of goodness, (satvam) the mode of goodness (f) and (tamaḥ) by pressing the darkness of darkness (rajaḥ) the mode of passion (and) so (eva) the (satvam) the mode of goodness.and (rajah) by suppressing the Rajoguna (tamah) the darkness (bhavati) is i.e. increases.।

verse.meaning: At the time when consciousness and consciousness power arises in this body and conscience and senses, at that time it should be known that Sattva Guna has increased.
verse.text:
सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते |
ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्वमित्युत ॥11॥
verse.word_meanings: (when) when the time (asmin) in this (dehe) body and (sarvadvareshu) consciousness and senses (prakasah) consciousness and (jnanam) discrimination (upajayate) arise (tada) that time (iti) so (vidyat) should be known.ut) that (satvam) the mode of Sattva (vivrdha) increases।

verse.meaning: Hey Arjun!Due to the increase in Rajoguna, greed, tendency, selfishness, the beginning of deeds, disturbance and the longing of subjects- all these arise.
verse.text:
लोभ: प्रवृत्तिरारम्भ: कर्मणामशम: स्पृहा |
रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ ॥12॥
verse.word_meanings: (Bharatarshabha) O Arjuna!(Rajasi) when the mode of passion (vivrirddhe) increases (lobha) greed (pravritti) instinct by selfishness (karmanam) with the desire for actions (arambha) the beginning (ashamah) the initiation and (spruha) the desire for sense gratification (etani) all (jayante) arising (jayante)They are।

verse.meaning: O Arjuna!When the darkness is increased, the consciousness and the senses are not light in the senses, the involvement of duty and negligence, i.e. vain action, and the bewitching instincts of the consciousness such as sleep.
verse.text:
अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च |
तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन ॥13॥
verse.word_meanings: (Kurunandana) O Arjuna!(तमसि) the darkness of the darkness (विवृद्धे) increasing the consciousness and senses (अप्रकाशः) non-light (अप्रवृत्तिः) non-involvement in duties and actions (च) and (प्रमादः) negligence, i.e. vain action (च) and (मोहः) the bewitching instincts of sleeping and others (एतानि) these all (एतानि)Eva) only (jayante) arise।

verse.meaning: When this man dies in the growth of Sattvaguna, then the pure divine heavens of those who do excellent deeds are attained.
verse.text:
यदा सत्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् |
तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते ॥14॥
verse.word_meanings: (when) when (dehabhrit) this man (satve) in the (pravriddhi) growth (pralayam) death (yati) attains (tada) then (utamavidam) the best of the performers of good deeds (amalaan) pure divine heavens etc.The worlds (pratipadyate) are attained।

verse.meaning: On increasing the rajoguna, death is produced in humans with attachment to deeds and when the tamoguna increases, the dead man is born in pests, animals etc.
verse.text:
रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते |
तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते ॥15॥
verse.word_meanings: (Rajasi) when the mode of passion is increased (pralaya) death (gatva) having attained (karmasangishu) actions (jayate) in the attachment of actions (tatha) and (tamasi) when the darkness is increased (pralinah) the dead man in the insect, animal etc.jayate) arises।

verse.meaning: The best action is said to be Sattvic, that is, happiness, knowledge and renunciation, etc., the fruit of Rajas karma is called ignorance and the fruit of suffering and Tamas action.
verse.text:
कर्मण: सुकृतस्याहु: सात्विकं निर्मलं फलम् |
रजसस्तु फलं दु:खमज्ञानं तमस: फलम् ॥16॥
verse.word_meanings: (सुकृतस्य) the best (कर्मनः) action is (सत्त्विकम्) Sattvika, that is, happiness, knowledge and renunciation, etc. (निर्मलम्) pure (पलम्) fruit (आहुः) is said (तु) but (राजसः) Rajas action (प्रह्कम्) fruit and so on.(तमसः) the (पलम्) fruit (अज्ञानम्) ignorance is called ignorance।

verse.meaning: Knowledge arises from the mode of goodness and without doubt, no doubt, greed and darkness, one should see in verse 13 of the same chapter) and delusion (see in this chapter.) and ignorance also arises.
verse.text:
सत्वात्सञ्जायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च |
प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च ॥17॥
verse.word_meanings: (सत्वत्) by the modes of Sattva (ज्ञानम्) knowledge (संजायते) arises (च) and (राजसः) by the mode of passion (एव) without doubt (लोभः) greed (च) and (तमसः) by the mode of darkness (प्रमादमोहौ) negligence and delusion (भवतः) ariseThey are and (agnyam) ignorance (eve)।

verse.meaning: The men in Sattvaguna go to the heavens to the heavens, the Rajas Purush located in the Rajoguna, ie man, lives in the middle of the human world and the work of Tamoguna, the sleepy, pramad and tamas male downgrati in Alasiyadi, ie insects, animals etc. to the lowly vagrants and hellsAre received
verse.text:
ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसा: |
जघन्यगुणवृत्तिस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसा: ॥18॥
verse.word_meanings: (सत्वस्थाः) the man in the mode of goodness, that is, the worshiper, that is, the worshiper (उध्वम्) the heavens and other worlds (गच्छन्ति) go to the Rajo-guna (राजसाः) Rajas Purusha, the worshiper, the worshiper, the worshiper, the middle, the earth world, the earthly world, that is, in the world of men, and (sthanti) are situated in the world of men and (in the world of qualities) ) The working form of the Tamogunas, in the form of action, negligence and laziness, (tamasa) Tamas Purusha, i.e. Shiva worshiper (Adhah) the underworld, i.e. hell, i.e., insects, animals, etc., (gachchanti) attain (gachchanti). Examples: Ravana, Bhashmasura etc.।

verse.meaning: At the time when the vision does not see anyone other than the three qualities, and as a very virtue, he knows God with the element, as Sachchidanandaghana, he attains my form at that time.
verse.text:
नान्यं गुणेभ्य: कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति |
गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भावं सोऽधिगच्छति ॥19॥
verse.word_meanings: (yada) when (drashta) discriminative seeker (gunebhyaḥ) three qualities - Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva (anyam) another (kartaram) Kartar, that is, the Lord (na) not (anpasyati) sees (saḥ) he (cha) (गुणेभ्यः) the three qualities, that is, Rajaguna, Brahma, Satguna, Vishnu and Tamguna Shiva (परम्) the other perfect Supreme Being (वेत्ति) by the essence (मद्भवम्) he (मद्भवम्) attains (अधिगतिगति) to my opinion. The meaning is that the seeker who does not believe in the three Lords, does not understand the other and understand that devotion is to God and never accept true devotion.।

verse.meaning: This male body (intellect, ego and mind and five senses, five karmandriyas, five ghosts, five senses- thus the body of these twenty-three elements. This gross body is the function of the qualities arising out of nature, hence these three The virtues are called the cause of this origin) due to origin, by violating these three qualities, the ecstasy is freed from birth, death, old age and all kinds of sorrows.
verse.text:
गुणानेतानतीत्य त्रीन्देही देहसमुद्भवान् |
जन्ममृत्युजरादु:खैर्विमुक्तोऽमृतमश्रुते ॥20॥
verse.word_meanings: H (dehi) the soul (dehasamudbhavan) the cause of the origin of the body (etan) these (train) these three (gunan) qualities, that is, the three Rajaguna Brahma, Satguna Vishnu, the Tamaguna Shiva, by violating (Atiatti) by violating and the scripture method of the Supreme Being. By doing (janmrutijara dukkhaih) birth, death, old age and all kinds of sufferings (vimuktah) liberated (amritam) the supreme bliss, i.e. complete, immortality (ashnute) attains immortality.।

verse.meaning: Arjuna said- With these three qualities, the past man has the past and what kind of conduct is the behavior and O Lord!With what measures humans have a past with these three qualities.
verse.text:
अर्जुन उवाच |
कैर्लिङ्गैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो |
किमाचार: कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते ॥21॥
verse.word_meanings: (एतान्) these (त्रैन्) three (गुणान्) qualities (अतीतः) past devotee (कैः) what (लिंगैः) characterized by (च) and (किमाचरः) what kind of conduct (भवति) is and (प्रभो) isLord!Man (katham) how (etan) these (train) three (gunan) qualities (ativartate) transcends, i.e., rises up.।

The male who is a kind of consciousness of lighting of the male sattvaguna (the consciousness of the conscience and the senses, the name is 'Prakash') and the working tendency of Rajoguna and the work for the work of Tamoguna The rhythm of conscious power in the conscience and senses should be understood here by the name 'Moh') neither envies them when they are enlightened nor aspire to them when they are retired. (The man who has become a constant, identical form in the Sachchidanandaghan God, has become completely past from the world, the form of this trigunamayi Maya, the conscience of that virtuous man has revealed light, tendency and mohadi circles to the work of all three qualities and not appearing for the three qualities in the proud conscience of that virtuous man. In any period, there are no disorders etc. disorders, this is the main symptom of having past with its qualities).
verse.text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव |
न द्वेष्टि सम्प्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ् क्षति ॥22॥
verse.word_meanings: (Pandava) O Arjuna!The seeker (prakasham) the light of the work of the mode of Sattva (f) and (pravrittim) the instinct of the action of the mode (cha) and (moham) the delusion of the action of the mode of darkness (eva) only (na) not (sampravrutti) when it is induced (dveshti) hates (cha)) And (not) not (nirtis) when they are withdrawn, they (ankasti) aspire।

verse.meaning: Which cannot be distracted by the qualities that have been located like a witness and the qualities are the only qualities (including the senses of the senses, including the conscience in their subjects, are 'to live in qualities')- it is understoodOne who is situated in the Sachchidanandaghan God in the same way and is never distracted by that situation.
verse.text:
उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते |
गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येवं योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते ॥23॥
verse.word_meanings: (यः) He who (udasinavat) the enjoyment of all things is destroyed by the indifferent i.e (वर्तन्ते) behaves (इति) as understanding (यः) who is situated in oneness in the Supreme Self (अविष्ठति) and (न,इङ्गते) never distracts by that position. The full parichitagahari nazari of the philosophy of the philosophy of the philosophy of the Gita is then influenced by the transient happiness that brings the three qualities, that is, the three Lords, Sri Brahma, Sri Vishnu and Sri Shiva. Their situation and power are familiar with power. A large reservoir becomes full faith. Similarly, after the knowledge of the perfect Brahman, the other masters do not become hatred, but complete faith becomes self-sufficient in that perfect God।

verse.meaning: Which is constantly located in self-emotion, considering sorrow and happiness, with equal emotion in soil, stone and gold, knowledgeable, dear and unpleasant and is the same in his blasphemy.
verse.text:
समदु:खसुख: स्वस्थ: समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चन: |
तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुति: ॥24॥
verse.word_meanings: (स्वस्थः) Based on the knowledge of the Tattva (समदुखुखः) the one who understands the equality of suffering and pleasure (समलोष्टास्मकांचः) the clay stone and gold (धीरः) the knower of the essence (तुत्यप्रियाप्रियः) the beloved and the unpleasant as one and (तुतुनिन्दात्मंस्तुतिः) the same in his condemning praise.।

verse.meaning: One who is equal in respect and humiliation, is also in favor of friend and Vary and is devoid of pride of act in the entire beginning, it is said to be male virtuous.
verse.text:
मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयो: |
सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीत: स उच्यते ॥25॥
verse.word_meanings: (मनापमानयोः) which is equal in honor and insult (तुतुराः) equal (मित्रारिपक्षयोः) friend and even in the side of the enemy (तुतुः) and (सर्वराम्पपित्यागि) is the renunciant of all beginnings and hatred under the control of hatred and subduing anyone.सः) That devotee (गुणातितः) is not affected by the formless power of the three Lords (Rajaguna Brahma, Satguna Vishnu and Tam Guna Shiva Ji).।

verse.meaning: And a man who considering the God of Avabhichari Bhakti Yoga (only an almighty God Vasudeva is his lord, abandoning selfishness and pride and continuously thinking of continuously with the ultimate love with reverence and emotion, is called 'Avabhicharya Bhakti Yoga').He also becomes worthy of attaining Sachchidanandaghan Brahma by crossing these three qualities.
verse.text:
मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते |
स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ॥26॥
verse.word_meanings:
(च) and (यः) the devotee (अविभिचरेण) invariant (भक्तियोगेन) by the yoga of devotion (माम्) constantly (सेवते) worships (सः) these (गुणान्) these three qualities (समात्तयि) well-doer (ब्रह्मभूयाय) To attain the Sachchidanandaghan Brahman (kalpate) becomes worthy, that is, the same one perfect God imagines.
The meaning:-- The meaning of Gita Chapter 14 Verse If Sri Brahma (Rajaguna) and Sri Shiva (Satguna) and Sri Shiva (Tamguna) are also practiced by me, who worships Me, i.e., the seeker of Brahma (Rajagun) and Sri Shiva, he is also the one who does it for the attainment of the perfect God. He violates, that is, he immediately removes his faithfulness and becomes worthy of attaining it in the unconditional devotion, that is, the perfect God in the true practice. He chants the Om-Tat-Sat Mantra described in Gita Chapter 17 Verse।

verse.meaning:
Because I am the shelter of that indestructible Parabrahma and the eternal Dharma and the unbroken Ekarasa Ananda
Om Tatsadit Srimad Bhagavad Gita Supanishadsu Brahmavidyayanyogashastra Sri Krishna-Arjuna-Samvade Gunatrayavibhaga Yoga Namachaturdashaadhyaya.
verse.text:

chapters.chapter_summary: The fifteenth chapter of the Bhagavad Gita is Purushottam Yoga. In Sanskrit, man means omnipresent God, and Purushottam means the timeless and mutual aspect of God. Krishna explains that the purpose of this great knowledge of God is to distinguish himself from the bondage of the material world and to understand Krishna as the supreme divine personality, who is the eternal controller and subscription of the world. He who understands this ultimate truth surrenders to God and becomes engaged in his devotional service.

chapters.chapter_summary: The sixteenwa chapter of the Bhagavad Gita is Divasur Samvadvatha Yoga. In this chapter, Krishna clearly describes two types of nature of humans- divine and demonic. People with demonic nature connect themselves to the methods of longing and ignorance, do not follow the rules of the scriptures and receive physical ideas. These people are born in the lower castes and get more tied to physical bonds. But those who are divine nature, they follow the instructions of the scriptures, do good things and purify the mind through spiritual practices. This increases divine qualities and eventually attains spiritual attainment.

chapters.chapter_summary: The seventeenth chapter of the Bhagavad Gita is the devotional age. In this chapter, Krishna describes three types of beliefs related to the three qualities of physical nature. Lord Krishna further states that this is the nature of faith that determines the quality of life and the character of living institutions. Those who believe in longing and ignorance do such tasks that give temporary and physical fruits, but those who believe in goodness work according to scriptural instructions and hence they get permanent and more proficient fruits. chapters.chapter_summary: The eighteenth chapter of the Bhagavad Gita is Mokshanyas Yoga. Arjun requests Krishna to please explain the difference between renunciation and renunciation. Krishna explains that a monk is the one who abandons the family and society to practice spiritual discipline, while a renunciation is the one who continues to dedicate to God without worrying about the fruits of his actions. Krishna explains that renunciation is superior to retirement. Then Krishna describes the three types of qualities of the physical world in detail. Krishna declares that the pure and true devotion of God is the highest path of spirituality. If we keep remembering them every moment, keep chanting their name, dedicateYourselfToThem,MakeThemOurSupremeGoal,ThenByTheirGraceWeWillDefinitelyBeAbleToRemoveAllObstaclesAndDifficultiesAndThisBirthAndDeathWillBeAbleToBeFreeFromTheCycle

verse.text:
व्यासप्रसादाच्छ्रुतवानेतद्गुह्यमहं परम् |
योगं योगेश्वरात्कृष्णात्साक्षात्कथयत: स्वयम् ॥75॥
verse.word_meanings: (व्यासासाप्रासादात्) By the mercy of Sri Vyasaji, having attained divine sight (अहम्) I have (एतत्) this (परम्) supreme (गुह्यम्) hidden (योगम्) Yoga to Arjuna (कथायतः) saying (स्वयम्) himself (योगेश्वरात्) Yogasvara (कृष्णात्) Lord Krishna.) The direct (hearing) is heard।

verse.meaning: Hey Rajan!I am happy again and again by remembering this mysterious, welfare and amazing dialogue of Lord Krishna and Arjuna again.
verse.text:
राजन्संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य संवादमिममद्भुतम् |
केशवार्जुनयो: पुण्यं हृष्यामि च मुहुर्मुहु: ॥76॥
verse.word_meanings: (Rajan) O king (Keshvarjunayoh) Lord Krishna and Arjuna (imam) this mysterious (punya) auspicious (cha) and (adbhutam) wonderful (Samvadam) dialogue (samsmriti,samsm kritya) repeatedly-death by (muhurmuhu) bar.-For (Hrishyami) I am happy।

verse.meaning: Hey Rajan!Srihari (who is destroyed by remembering sins, his name is 'Hari') and after remembering that very unique form again, I am a great surprise in my mind and I am getting happy again and again.
verse.text:
तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरे: |
विस्मयो मे महानराजन्हृष्यामि च पुन: पुन: ॥77॥
verse.word_meanings: (Rajan) O king!(Hareh) Sri Harike (that) that (ati) very (wonderful) peculiar (form) form (cha) also (samsmriti, sammritya) repeatedly dies (me) in my mind (great) great (vismayah) is surprising (f) and (again,again) repeatedly (Hrishyami) I am happy।

verse.meaning: O Rajan!Where there is Lord Krishna, Lord Krishna, where there is Arjuna, the bow-bearer, there is Sri, Vijay, Vibhuti and Achal Niti- this is my opinion.
verse.text:
यत्र योगेश्वर: कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धर: |
तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम ॥78॥
verse.word_meanings: (यत्रा) where (Yogasvaraḥ) Yogeshwara (Krishnaḥ) Lord Krishna and (Yatra) where (Dhanurdharah) Gandhiva-Dhanushadhari (Parth) Arjuna (tatra) there (Shri) Sri (Vijayah) Victory (Bhuti) Vibhuti and (Dhruva)The immovable (nitiḥ) is policy (my) my (matiḥ) opinion।

verse.meaning: Hey Bharatshrestha! Now you listen to three types of happiness from me. The pleasure in which the seeker makes a human being Raman with the practice of hymn, meditation and sevadi and which leads to the end of sorrows, which is such happiness, although in the beginning, it seems like poison (such as a child with attachment in sports Practice is equal to the first poison due to stupidity, in the same way, a man with attachment in subjects is the first 'appears to be equal to the poison' due to not knowing the practice of Bhagavadbhajan, meditation, service etc. It is equivalent, so the happiness arising from the offerings of divine intellect is said to be sattvik.
verse.text:
सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं शृणु मे भरतर्षभ |
अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दु:खान्तं च निगच्छति ॥36॥
यत्तदग्रे विषमिव परिणामेऽमृतोपमम् |
तत्सुखं सात्विकं प्रोक्तमात्मबुद्धिप्रसादजम् ॥37॥
verse.word_meanings: (Bharatarshabha) O best of Bharatas! (Idan) now (trividham) three kinds of (sukham) happiness (tu) also thou (me) from me (shrurn) hear. (यत्रा) in which (अप्रयात्) in practice (रमते) absorbed (च) and by which (दुखान्तम्) the end of suffering (निगति) attains (यत्) which is such happiness (तत्) he (अग्रे) in the beginning, though (विषाम् ) is equal to the poison (like) but in (pariname) in the result (amrutapamam) equal to immortal therefore (tat) he (atmabuddhiprasadajam) arising from the grace of the Supreme Self (sukham) happiness (sattvika) Sattvik (proctam) is said।
